text: [music playing]

ADAM CARROLL: To be a racing
driver is what I always--

I never thought
of anything else.

And in my own mind, that's
what I always wanted to be.

You know, when you're
young, you don't

understand how hard,
or the reality that
comes with that to achieve it.

But I guess that's
where you have to start.
With the dream.
And it started at Nutts Corner.

We're here in Nutts Corner,
which was my home cart circuit,

and where I started when
I was nine years old.

So it's brilliant
to be back here

and, you know, just to come
back to where I started.
It's great.
[music playing]

Anything with an engine or the
moves, I was kind of on it.

So I ended up getting a
go-kart for Christmas.

I think I had the engine
blown up within an hour,

because you can't really just
drive it around the house.

The guy we got it off said,
"You need to take him racing."
[music playing]

I've always been, actually,
a fan of Jaguar cars.

I started as the test
driver for the team,
and got the rear seat.
So that's where it happened.

And to end up driving for them
and to be a factory driver
is the dream come true.

But the cars are perfect
for the tracks we race
on-- street circuits, downtown.

You know, they're not
super long tracks,
so they're absolutely perfect.

Also, the technology involved
is probably the hardest part.

Once you get over, yes, it's
a little bit quiet to start.

But you can hear so
many other things.

You can hear noises that
you've never heard before.

Especially the start of a
race, like in Hong Kong,

when the lights are
building up, it's silence.
And then, off you go.
You hear everything.
Tires locking.

People crashing and
hitting into each other.

Crashes and bangs,
which you never really
heard before over the engine.
That was unique.

ANNOUNCER 1: You can
easily see the difference

between the Jaguars,
because there's

an inch-high strip of
color just below the camera

on top of the roll hood.
ANNOUNCER 2: Thanks, guys.

ANNOUNCER 1: See?
There you go.

ANNOUNCER 2: They are beautiful
cars, thought, aren't they?

ANNOUNCER 1: They
are beautiful, yeah.

However, being able to
tell the drivers apart
could be quite useful to us.

ADAM CARROLL: I think I was
working incredibly hard.
But yes, we need to improve.

And we are improving
all the time.

And we will improve
the performance
and move up the grid.

ANNOUNCER 1: Lopez
in the Virgin car.

He's just easy
meat for everybody.
Adam Carroll gets alongside him.
They slow each other down.

ADAM CARROLL: I've always
been kept in check because
motorsport is incredibly tough.
And we're new to this.
The team is completely new.
I'm new.

And we have our own
agenda, really, with what
we want to achieve to start.

ANNOUNCER 2: Again, with
Jaguar, they haven't
had to start-- they want it.

But I'm telling you, that
team, great people in it.
The drivers are first-class.

Just give them some
time, give them

a bit of experience and focus,
and figure out the weak areas.

ADAM CARROLL: To become
contenders, we need more time.

We have started
in a championship
that is incredibly competitive.

You know, the guys have
two years head start on us.
This is a learning year, also.

So yes, we want to get
into the points, of course.

But this is all towards
our main goal, which

is to be competitive
as quickly as possible
and to make next year.

To be the best car
that we know we can.
